DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numerical value that represents the assessment of the color of the skin of a neonate, as a component of the APGAR test.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing._A component of the APGAR score, it is the numerical value assigned to an assessment of the color of the skin of a neonate. 0 = pale blue; 1 = pink body and pale blue extremities; 2 = pink body and extremities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A test devised by Dr. Virginia Apgar to assess the overall health of a newborn upon birth. The test is administered at one and five minutes after birth and allows for the assignation of numerical values between zero and two for specific observations regarding skin color, pulse rate, reflex irritability, muscle tone and breathing.
